intro: Piofontia ochracea, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. The plant has hairy, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert regions. Its unique appearance and adaptation to harsh conditions make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
